meanings.definition: A unit of information equal to one million bits.
meanings.sent1: I downloaded a game that took up several megs on my computer.
meanings.sent2: The file size was too large, so I had to free up some megs of space.
meanings.sent3: My friend's phone ran out of megs right when he was about to send an important email.
meanings.sent4: Her brain felt like it was filled with megs of useless information.
meanings.sent5: The megs of data flowing through the network were overwhelming.

meanings.sent1: I need to upgrade my storage to accommodate more megs of photos.
meanings.sent2: The software update required several megs of space on my phone.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally deleted a few megs of important documents.
meanings.sent4: His music collection was so vast, it spanned several megs of memory.
meanings.sent5: The megs of data stored on the hard drive were carefully organized.

meanings.sent1: The processor speed was measured in megs, indicating its performance.
meanings.sent2: The old computer could only handle a few megs of processing power.
meanings.sent3: The megs of frequency were crucial for the smooth operation of the device.
meanings.sent4: Her heartbeat quickened, like the megs of a racing engine.
meanings.sent5: The megs of energy pulsating through the circuit were mesmerizing.
